result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Br. 13

Defendant Larry R Daniels in court in custody. Prosecuting Atty Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Paul M Fredrickson in court for Defendant Larry R Daniels. State moves to find counts 1-2 to be transactionally related. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds counts 1-2 transactionally related. Detective L. L. duly sworn and testified. Atty. DeMarco with direct. Witness identified DE in courtroom. Atty. Fredrickson with cross. Atty. DeMarco with redirect. State moves for bindover, reserves argument. DE objects, waives argument. Court found probable cause and ordered bindover.

03:35 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Jacob A Idlas.  Robin W Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
